The waitress forgot to bring an appetizer and brought me something else that I didn't order... :/ I still ate it... because I was too hungry to wait for what I originally ordered.  They had no bread at the start of my meal so I was very hungry... the wait was long.  Next time am in town I will give it another try... the food is still good just think the waitress/waiter should be a bit more attentive.

I came in for dinner yesterday.. I had the Arroz con Pollo and it was the BOMB! i hadn't had chicken in a while and the flavors were right on and it wasnt greasy or dry. my fam that i was with enjoyed there food although they was some confusion with the menu.  My fam said the steak was a little dry but they are picky but IDK for sure.  The ingredients were fresh and the flavors were amazing!  Peruvian Beer is good.. I only took a sip of both options.  If u want to drink something other than soda or water  The Purple Drink is  good.  (made there fresh takes 4 hours.)

Delicious. You must go here. We usually go to Ta Ta, but decided to drop by Mi Peru instead. I had the white fish in lime juice that was so, so tasty and my husband had the beef soltada. The beef was juicy and very well seasoned. We had wine and beer that was also very good. Service was excellent. This was the first time I've tried Peruvian food and I love it!

I was at Mi Peru Grill on Jan 23.  We were a party of around 16 people, most of whom had never had Peruvian food before.  The food was delicious, the service was prompt and polite, the restaurant clean, and nicely decorated.    We ordered different dishes, Lomo Satado, Ceviche, Papa a la Huancaina, Arroz con Mariscos, and Tallarines Verdes.  Their presentation was spotless and they all tasted great.  The Chef/Owner (Ray) took the time to say hi to us and inquire about the service and food.    I will be back again.

i am Peruvian, so i am picky about the Peruvian restaurants i go to. i came here a few weeks back and it was pretty good. the portions were decent enough to share with another person as well. i had the aji de gallina and ceviche mixto. the ceviche was AMAZING and it had pure, authentic flavor. the aji de gallina was ok but it was lacking some spice and authentic flavor. i was kinda upset when i ordered lucuma ice cream and they were out =[, only thing they had was mini alfajores, which were pretty good as well.  I gave it four stars because the service was fast, the staff was super friendly, and the food was enjoyable.  only downfall of the place is that the food is a bit overpriced. spice up the food a bit more, and it would be almost perfect. ill most likely come back for more food and to try out their other dishes.

First, the positive: the shrimp ceviche was the best I've had in Las Vegas - hands down. Amazing. The cilantro chicken dish I tried was also very good.   The not-quite-so-positive: my wife's steak was overcooked and bland. Also, with an shared appetizer and entree each, it quickly turned into a $55 lunch - and we don't even drink.   Next time I think I'll just order the appetizer as my meal and I will be a happy camper!
I am Peruvian and the ceviche and papa a la huancaina was very bland no real flavor and way over priced

I was working in Henderson for a few months and happened to find Mi Peru via Yelp and by a local Peruvian co-worker's recommendation. I was hooked after my first meal and made a point of eating there at least once a week during my extended stay.  The restaurant is decorated in simple but good taste. It is a small family owned restaurant. Cleanliness is key for me and I always checkout the restrooms of where I dine - that always give you a good idea of what the sanitation practices of a place. The restaurant was clean and pleasant overall.  The star of place is definitely the food. In my multiple visits, there was nothing that I could say I didn't like. I am the type of person who tries to stay away from restaurants that are "Americanized" to suit locals' taste buds. I love the flavors authentic ethnic cuisines have to offer and Mi Peru definitely does a great job of this.  I make a point of visiting a Peruvian restaurant when I find one in whatever city I am in, and Mi Peru is one I can't stop talking about. The quality and the affordable price of the "Tiradito". This is a raw fish dish similar to sashimi, but differs from ceviche in the cut of the fish and lack of onions. It is typically served with sweet potato and corn with a citrus sauce. The tiradito is a must have. The second dish I love from Mi Peru is the "Causa" - made with mashed potatoes, canned tuna, hard boiled egg, avocado and lime juice. I would have never tried it from just reading the description on the menu but tried it since my friend had highly recommended. It was delicious. The way the flavors blended together was surprising. I made sure to order this as often as possible as well.  I tried the lomo saltado, the choros a la criolla, pollo a la brasa, ceviche and the arroz con pollo when I was with a larger group. You just couldn't go wrong with any of these dishes.  The next time I am in Vegas, I will make sure to dine in Mi Peru again even if it out of the way. Mi Peru now the restaurant I compare all Peruvian restaurants to.

My favorite Latin American restaurant in the Las Vegas valley.  Authentic Peruvian cuisine with its flavorful and eclectic combinations of meat, vegetables, fruit, and spices. Mi Peru is tucked away in a quiet plaza near Horizon Ridge and Stephanie. Mi Peru also serves a wide selection of South American wines and beers.  Don't forget to sample the homemade deserts.  Outstanding ethnic cooking, reasonable prices, easy access from the 215.  Don't miss it.
This place is awesome. The food is amazing and the service was stellar. This is my favioret place in Vegas!!!!

Wow! This place is amazing!! The food is so rich in flavor and very filling. My husband would have licked the plate if he could have. We both got different steak dishes mine had pesto spaghetti with it that had an amazing rich flavor. His reminded me of carne aside fries but with perfectly caramelized vegetables.  I can't wait to go back and try more food! Totally worth the money.

I've had my share of Peruvian places in California, but this place is pretty good!   We ordered the Lomo Saltado which didn't disappoint, side of plantains which I always have to get, and arroz con mariscos.   I would come back.

Not sure how this gem stayed under my radar for so long, but it's a straight 5* even independent of its unassuming location in Henderson in a random strip mall.  I already knew the place was a winner the first time I had the chupe de camarones (basically a seafood bisque), which was perfectly soul-warming. I'd come here just for the chupe de camarones - that's how good it is.  Otherwise, my usual go-to entree is the lomo saltado; strongly recommend getting it with tacu tacu (beans mixed with rice) instead of the standard french fries and rice. The lomo saltado is super tender and the accompanying tomatoes/onions are always perfectly cooked. Otherwise I opt for the chicarrones, and no matter what, I always try to talk my party into splitting either the chaufa especial (mixed rice with shrimp, beef, and chicken) or the arroz con marisos (something like a seafood paella).  Henderson people are super lucky to have this gem on their side of town.

I can't believe I hadn't been to Mi Peru sooner than this. The three of us had an excellent meal! We were there around 5 on a Friday so it wasn't too busy yet. Our server was incredibly friendly and willing to go over the menu with us. The food was all excellent! So flavorful! Each of us started making happy noises with our first bites. We are looking forward to going back.
Everything I have tried here has been amazing! The fish calamari mix dish is so good ,especially if you add the green sauce. Very friendly staff and convent location off Horizon Ridge.

Yuummm!!! I absolutely love this place! Its a small restaurant, which I like, It feels very home like and it looks cozy inside. The waiter was very nice and friendly, we told him it was our first time here and he did explain what we were getting since we weren't sure what it was exactly. I ordered the Lomo de carne. Which has seriously at that moment become my favorite food. It has meat with French fries, onions, tomatoes and comes with a side of rice. It had a yummy little juice in the meat. So yea, this place is delicious.

My daughter had the Peruvian fried chicken. It was cooked perfectly and was super good.  I had the Lomo Saltado. I've never had it before to compare with anything else. I really liked it. The meat was well seasoned. The portion was too big for me though.  My boyfriend had the chef special which was a fried rice with beef and shrimp. He finished his whole plate and some of mine. We'll be back since it's pretty close to home and a great variety of something different.

First time at this restaurant, I was so pleasantly surprised! We went for lunch, the owner Rhimie was our server. He was very friendly and helpful, explained all the dishes to us. Would definitely recommend this place! Delicious!!!

We were pretty impressed with the food.  We split the ceviche (YUM) appetizer.  Perfectly tangy and flavorful.  I had seco de carne... the beef was moist and tender, and the vegetables, beans and rice were a great compliment.  He had the anticuchos combo, and the meat tasted right off the grill. We do think it's a little overpriced for the area and what you get, but it was a good meal and good service.  The music is Peruvian, but the pan flute gets a little tiresome after 45 minutes or so.  Will definitely come here again for a special occasion.

My wife and I were greeted warmly and were seated immediately, our food took a bit longer but I must say well worth the wait at the end. Lomo Saltado and Bistek Apanado are my favorite. Could not be more satisfied , and its not too far away from where I live.

My friend and I stumbled upon this restaurant on our way to find Settlebello in Henderson.  We were thrilled because Peruvian food is something both she and I miss tremendously.  We went in and I ordered the Arroz con pollo (Chicken rice) and she ordered the Arroz con mariscos (Seafood rice) and they both did not disappoint.  The portion of rice was generous on both plates.  Mine came with two pieces of chicken and colorfully green flavored rice.  There was some red onion salsa on the side -- it was good!  Hers had two mussels and seafood mixed into the rice...  delicious.  I recommend the passion fruit drink and a side of plantains to go with your meal.  They both compliment the meal very well!  I normally order the Bistec a lo Pobre when I'm at a Peruvian joint, so I'd have to go back and try it!  But Hurray for Peruvian food in Vegas!

Ambiance - 3 stars - nothing outstanding, but it was clean and not too noisy, and thus is a place where you can have a conversation during your meal.  It does have some design features, but basically is a restaurant in a strip mall (a nice, clean, on the quiet side restaurant).  Service - 5 stars plus - excellent and attentive service.  The server brought out our drinks immediately, and then gave us the perfect amount of time to decide what we wanted next.  She was helpful with suggestions, and actually had some passion about the food she was serving.  The best thing, and it's really a treat, is that she never was intrusive, but was always attentive.  I was surprised because I was never caught off guard, and whenever I wanted something or had a question, she was at hand without me having to gesture for attention (seriously she was almost psychic, she was that good).  Granted there were only two other tables in the restaurant at the time I ate, but still, everything was perfectly timed, extremely professional and pleasant while still being friendly.  Food - 4 stars - We started off with yucca root and a creamy sauce reminiscent of hollandaise.  It was reminiscent of potato (only not quite) and the flavors was quite subtle and enjoyable.  The yucca root was perfectly cooked (crispy but not greasy exterior, and soft interior), and the sauce was subtle enough to allow you to appreciate the distinction between yucca and potato.   The main courses were Arroz con Mariposa and Lomo Saltado.  The Arroz con Mariposa had a delightful flavor that was subtly spiced.  The octopus was perfectly cooked, though the shrimp and mussels were slightly overcooked (maybe a minute too long?  just enough to notice but not enough to make you want to stop eating!).  Overall a satisfying experience that played on the taste-buds.  The Lomo Saltado was uniquely seasoned and in a beautiful way.  Flavor wise, it was excellent, but sadly the meat was slightly overcooked.  Again, it was a situation where the overcooking was noticeable but the overall flavors were such that it outweighed any real complaint.  My favorite thing about the Lomo Saltado was the cilantro aftertaste which I don't usually associate with beef.  It was pleasant and hearty.  Dessert was Ice cream lucuma with Nazca Lines.  Iucuma is a fruit from Peru, which is a bit hard to describe, but overall the dessert was wonderful and not too sweet.  My only regret was that i think the dessert could have paired perfectly with a cup of hot green tea.  The dessert presentation was beautiful with decorative nazca reminiscent lines on the plate.  Drink - 3 stars - Purple corn drink.  It's spicy in a mulled wine sort of way, refreshing in an iced tea sort of way, and overall a unique, pleasant experience that truly enhances the spices of the meal. I noticed they do have a smaller than normal drink selection, but do include several import beers (I stuck with the purple corn drink, because it was good!).  Recommendations - The yucca root with the creamy sauce was excellent, as was everything else we tried.  I particularly liked the seafood paella taste of the Arroz con Mariposa, but also enjoyed the Lomo Saltado with it's surprising aftertastes.  Definitely I recommend getting the Purple Corn Drink to go with any meal you choose.  Avoid - I wouldn't say avoid anything, but perhaps suggest the chef undercook some foods compared to normal.  The spices and flavors will be mild and subtle, so overall not much to avoid here.

This is probably one of my favorite Peruvian restaurants. I'm Peruvian and I can say that the food tastes just as if I was in Peru. My boyfriend goes here all the time, and the service is good too! Their seco de carne con frijoles and arroz con pollo are very very good. They have dishes that you usually do not find at other Peruvian restaurants, which makes this place unique.

Do not go there. Not worth your time, money or calories. First time not good their rice tasted like fast chinese food and they didn't have grilled chicken for which Peruvian food is mostly know for. Gave them a second chance, no papa rellena, again no chicken. Service is slow, non-courteous and food was bland compared to other Peruvian food I've had in other cities. They better make things better if they want to survive here.

Great tasting food, different flavors, good for a change from the sacrosanct trinity Italian-Chinese-Mexican (that I love by the way). We tried the Papa Rellena, a meat stuffed deep fried potato, common to other Latino cuisines; very good. The Aji de Gallina, shredded curry chicken with potato and rice, was also very good. This was during the lunch special, and the only downer was the size of the servings, on the smaller side.
Lomo saltado is on point. Ali sauce is yummy. Has just enough kick. Gustavo was a great server. We will be going back.

I haven't had the chance to dine in at Mi Peru, but I ordered take-out through Bite Squad. I ordered the Anticucho de Lomo (beef tenderloin kabobs with fried potatoes) and Aguadito de Pollo (soup with chicken, rice, cilantro, carrots, and potato). My food arrived hot and very well packaged.   The Anticucho de Lomo was good, but not one of the best meals I've had. The beef was seasoned and slightly tender. The fried potatoes didn't have any flavor, but the spicy green sauce that came with it made them quite tasty. The portion seemed small for the price.  The Aquadio de Pollo was very tasty. It reminded me of a step up from the normal chicken noodle soup since it had cilantro and rice instead of noodles. The rice, chicken, potatoes, and carrots were plentiful in this soup. There was enough soup for two people and it was a generous portion for the price.  Looking at the menu online I wonder if maybe I just didn't choose the most exciting items. I think I'll have to try dining at the restaurant in the near future to see if I like it more.
Food was good. It was our first time here. We ordered Civeche for appetizer and I had Chaufa Rice for dinner. We will come back again and try other dishes.

Loved this place! Tony was great explaining all the varieties and styles of foods on the menu, since it was our first time trying South American food.  I had the Seco de Carne and hubby had the Tacu Tacu con Saltado, along with fried Plantains and then a wonderful coconut Flan for desert. All seasoned perfectly and enough food for another dinner later. Great experience, really had fun and will be back soon!

Actually a really great little Shop the food here is different and also very tasty. I highly recommend the beef with the cilantro rice absolutley fantastic. Prices are a bit higher for a little Shop like this so expect to pay for the food but it is well worth it I haven't eaten much Peruvian fare but I really like the idea of it sweet succulent beef meats and tangy spicy chicken like I said before the cilantro rice is fantastic the veggies are cooked perfectly soft so thay don't lose to much flavor if you are on this side of town or looking for a new spot to order some takeout absolutely give this place a shit you won't regret it I promise. One downside is that the delivery does take quite some time compared to the other restaurants In The area.

This review is about a month overdue.    Experience:  Came with a group of folks to try something different.  Was looking forward to it, since I never had Peruvian food before. There was about 10 of us and we came at lunch time.   Service:  The staff was still setting up when we came in, but were very helpful when we needed anything.   Food:  They put down some corn nut type munchies that have a nice spicy green sauce that I just loved.  I had a Peruvian friend who told me to try the Papa A La Huancaina. It was good, but a little rich. It was almost like a hollandaise sauce over boiled potato slices.  Then we had the Yuquitas Fritas, and they reminded me of potatoes...maybe just a bit bland with some good sauce to dip it in.  My main course was the Chicharrones.  It was roast pork with fried sweet potato slices and a hominy salad on the side.  I liked this dish, especially the pork.   Facility:  The restaurant was a quaint little place that was kinda long and not wide. It sat our group fairly well.  It did have some Peruvian flair to the atmosphere with the decor.   Overall:  this place was good, but not amazing.  I would come back with friends, but since it's out of the way, it will not be anytime soon.

This is the most consistent place I've been too.  We used to go here a lot as it was right around the corner from where we used to live.  Each and every time, your food tastes exactly the same as it did the last time.    It's been a while since I've been back here, since moving I've tried a few other places closer to my house and nothing compares to this place.  The service is good the food is amazing and it's worth the short drive to come back here.  The beans & rice has an amazing taste like no other place.  Everything here is fresh, from the ceviche to the Flan it is worth it.  I HIGHLY recommend this place.

I want to give this place six stars because it's so good, but I apparently don't have that option. Sucks.   I love this place, guys. I really do. They have really good food here, and it's truly the best Peruvian food I've had in Las Vegas, on par with El Rocoto in California. Not only that, but it's nice to go to a Peruvian place that has a real restaurant feel to it - some Peruvian places are a little bit more dumpy, where this place is really dressed up. Win for this place, my friends. But I won't bore you with details of the decor (it's tasteful), the staff (friendly and polite), or parking (plentiful!). Let's talk food.   The food here is great. That's all there is to it. Please, please, please listen to me when I recommend that you get the jalea for your party. Trust me. It's so good it'll knock your socks off. Plus, the dish is huge! I order that just so that my date/family/whomever-I'm-eating-with eats that and leaves my plate alone. Plus, the red diced onions?! I could eat those as a dish.   Whatever you eat, you need to drink chicha. It's a purple maiz drink, which makes it sound gross. Except it's the exact opposite of gross! It's an epic win! If you're not feeling that adventurous, try the Inca Kola. My non-Peruvian friends tell me it tastes like bubblegum, though I say it tastes like happiness. Also, try the lucuma ice cream. I really have no way of telling you how good this is, other than to tell you it's amazing.   Everything here is good. The lomo saltado, ceviche, jalea... everything. It's really good food! I'm trying to think of more things to say that will tell you how good it is, but I can't. Because my work schedule was nuts for a while, I haven't been here in forever. I need to come back here soon, so you'll probably see me here when you come!

Can't believe it's almost been a year since we had been there.  Once again we enjoyed a great late lunch with excellent service If your searching for a great alternative to Mexican....It's right here We won't wait so long next time.  Ciao

I have eaten here twice and it is okay, average, nothing spectacular... The service is really good...The waiter explains the popular menu items and goes through everything, even the specialty drinks.  You get bread and a cilantro-esque dipping sauce.  One of the two times, I also got pickled veggies. I got the lomo saltado on trip one, a beef stirfry with fries and rice...it is good, enough food for 2 meals, but slightly oily.  Tastes good reheated!  The second time, I got the bistec - steak with grilled onions (big chunks), tomatoes, rice, fries and plantains with a fried egg on top.  I did have to ask for the plaintains as they were forgotten, but when I got them they were hot, sweet and delicious.  The fried egg is a nice touch. The prices are high (approximately $16 for a dish) but it is worth trying a new cuisine.  I think each entree could feed a normal person of either gender for dinner and lunch the next day.  I just don't think my two experiences and the experience of my new-to-Peruvian-food dining companion warrant another trip.
Ordered arroz con mariscos, which was some of the best I have tasted. Great friendly service and good location just outside of Vegas.

Fantastic place! Simple yet lovely decor, very welcoming...   We went here for a friend's birthday gathering and everyone at the table would probably give their dish 4-5 stars. The food here is absolutely fantastic... very authentic and hearty. The portions are ideal and there is something on the menu for everyone.   The server recommended an amazing dish for me and was attentive the entire time we were there. I had the fried fish with shrimp sauce and rice but was also able to try their steak, rice, beef skewers, and variety of seafood. Needless to say, I enjoyed every bite :). I highly recommend going here and we will definitely be back!

The food here is fun and unique - plus yummy!  The whole family liked what we ordered.  I had fried pork and yams my girls both loved the chicken and steak with rice and a soy sauce - I definitely felt like I was back in South America.  I was surprised at how quite it was but as it got later, more customers strolled in.  I think the restaurant must get busier as it gets later in the evening.    Looking for something unique but easy to get in and out?  Try Mi Peru.

let me begin by saying this was the first time I've ever had Peruvian food and it was amazing. The fish ceviche was amazing, both of our meals were delicious. I stumbled on this place through restaurant.com and i will def be going back. Really great food, not like Mexican food at all which i don't like, so if your in the area go there!

The food was "OK". It has great reviews so we decided to try it out. We had some tuna with mash potatoe appetizer sprinkled with raw onions and a green sauce.  That was good! The steak and plantains were pretty greasy and it actually made my stomach hurt for a couple days. I don't think I'd recommend this just cause if the grease but if you can handle it then it's a must try.
The food was authentic and delicious, they were out a cook when my family and I came in. Although we had to wait 45 minutes just to be seated/served...the food was worth it

This small, informal restaurant serves Peruvian fare - duh.  We started off with a complimentary salad of jicama, carrots, cucumber and onion in lime juice and a cup of aji dipping sauce.  This salad proved to be both spicy, refreshing and the best dish we consumed this evening.  Our shared appetizer was papa a la huancaina - boiled potatoes covered with a mild aji sauce and cream.  I could not taste the aji sauce and the overall flavor was muted.  I also tried a glass of chica morado - a purple corn drink which was pretty good though it won't be replacing diet Pepsi at Hacienda de Westie.  Ann ordered arroz con Mariscos - a mixed seafood dish with rice billed as being Peru's take on paella.  I settled on a mixed seafood soup called parihucla that the menu described as Peru's take on bouillabaisse.  Both entrees were bland and compared unfavorably to their better known counterparts.

Roasted Corn with Spicy Aji Sauce: This is placed at your table to snack on. The roasted corn is amazing. A bit difficult to dip in the aji, but so great together. Also, the aji sauce really packed a kick, yow!  Causa de Pollo ($9.95): Classic Peruvian appetizer of mashed potato layers, stuffed with chicken salad, and a mild aji sauce. Served with boiled egg, and pickled red onion. The potatoes are really creamy and go so well with the chicken salad mixture. The pickled red onion provides the perfect balance to this creamy dish.  Yuquitas Fritas ($8.95): Fried yucca root with Peruvian dipping sauce. I love yucca root! The dipping sauce was creamy and delicious. We loved mixing it with the spicy aji sauce.  Bistec a lo Pobre ($17.95): Beef steak with grilled onion, fries, white rice, fried plantain, and fried egg. Very similar to the popular Lomo Saltado, except this dish doesn't have tomato and is served with fried sweet plantain and fried egg. The beef was flavorful and tender. Everything was delicious, though I didn't care for the fried plantain in this combination.  Tallarines Verdes con Carne ($15.95): Thin steak with pesto spaghetti. Again, the steak was great. The pasta was just okay for me.  Great spot to try Peruvian specialties. Everything was great and service was fantastic. They were so accommodating.
food is excellent and service is superb. we had the arroz con mariscos (like spanish paella or like a seafood risotto, in a way) and chicharrones (fried pork).
Huge portions, great service, authentic Peruvian food! Why are you still reading this? Go to mi Peru! :p

My friend and I decided to check Mi Peru out for lunch today. It's a nice place and their service was pretty good. I haven't had too much experience with Peruvian food but I enjoyed my meal here. I wouldn't say it was amazing, but it was tasty. I had the Estofado de Pollo, which is chicken stewed in tomato sauce with potatoes, and it comes with some steamed rice. My friend had the Seco de Carne, which is stewed beef in a cilantro sauce, served with potatoes, rice and beans. I tried the beef and it was VERY tender. The flavor was also pretty good. The portions are pretty big, so we didn't have room for dessert.

Ordered the peruvian fried chicken 4 piece Tasted pretty delicious. I  enjoyed the seasoning and fried perfectly leaving a nice tender taste.  French fries was abundant for 4 pieces. What I didn't like about this place was they didn't serve the bread with the green chili salsa. They served kernals instead. Also they charged for refills.  My fiance ordered the mariscos con arroz and she loved it! I also like all the Peruvian decorations also.

Came in here with a group of three and one peruvian.  I thought the food was excellent, but more important he thought the food was excellent.  It was later in the evening so there weren't many people there but the service was excellent.  Expect to spend around $12-17 per person but it is worth it if you like Peruvian food.   I had the Anticucho De Corazon which is beef kabobs with fried potatoes and a side of corn.  The corn was amazing, not sure where they get it.  It isn't a ton of food but it is good quality.    If I lived in the area I would definitely come back.

I guess our complaints are getting attention. I gave this place one more shot and the service was a big improvement. I moved it up from 1 star to 3. I'm not to happy with the new changes in recipes though:( the arroz con polo was great but the causa w/shrimp was so much better with chopped shrimp, smaller Pieces of onion, no olive sprinkled into it and where did my egg go? Also the anticucho de lomo seasoning seemed to have changed:( I was happy to see they had domestic beer this time.

I can't even tell you how wonderful the peruvian cuisine is here. Actually, I can. I went to this place because I live very close by. I didn't expect much when walking in. Decor is cool, but it was not busy at all which worried me. We asked the waiter what his fave dish was and he said the Lomo Saltado. I ordered it and fell in love the minute the food touched my lips. It's quality beef strips, sauteed with white onions and sliced tomoatoes. It is cooked in a vinegar/beer marinade and tossed with french fries. My husband got the Milanesa. It is breaded steak with a side of a beautiful pesto pasta. We haven't tried any seafood here but that happens to be one of their specialties. This place is perfect for a date night, or bringing family to for a night of great food.

Arroz con pollo was spicy and tasty. Tender chicken on the bone. Fun rhythmic tunes played while we dined. Atmosphere is ok. I would come back for this dish. 3 and a half stars. Cool to get something different and experience something new. My guess is most dishes here are solid.

We went in here again last night for dinner, and once again, I was surprised to see it so dead.  There were maybe 2 other tables the entire time we were there.  It's so cute, the service is great, and best of all, the food is amazing.  We ordered the ceviche and this tuna thing.  OMG, the tuna thing is melt in your mouth delicious.  The ceviche, as always, was on point.  This is really the best ceviche I've ever had from any restaurant.    Next came the combo anticuchos with shrimp instead of beef hearts because...well, I'm just not into beef hearts.  We also ordered the lomo tallarin saltado but this time it came with the wider fettucini style noodles instead of the spaghetti style noodles.  I'm not sure why, but this makes such a huge difference in this dish.  It was so good!  I daresay it's on par with Little Dumplings now.  The last dish we got was the Chauffa Esecial - Peruvian fried rice.  So good!  They had a special on a bottle of Gauchos Malbec, which tasted exactly as it was described to us.  It was the perfect pairing for the perfect meal.  Mi Peru is a true hidden gem and I hope more people get attuned to it because it would be a shame if it closed down.

I lived in Peru for a year and I have to say that Peruvian food is one of my favorites. My favorite dish in Peru was the lomo saltado with tacu tacu and I was glad to see that this restaurant serves this dish. I like my lomo saltado medium well and I am used to it being served with potatoes, onions and tomatoes. The version made at this restaurant did not have the potatoes and the meat was cooked well done.  The dish per se was good. The flavors were there and the portion was big. I took some home because of how much food I was served. I wish my portion was smaller and that the dish was more affordable. It is one of the priciest dishes in the menu.   I did like that they had Peruvian beer like Cusqueña and Cristal. They are my faves :). Overall, this is a place I would come back to when I am craving Peruvian food.
i went to this place cause its close to my house.  Fook is ok.  Service could be better.  I would try again and see, might be their off night.

I am from LA, and my favorite peruvian restaurants there are Mario's and El Rocoto. Those are the best peruvian restaurants in LA. So when I came upon Mi Peru, I just had to try it. I am proud to say I have found a place in Las Vegas, my second home, that satisfies my LOMO SALTADO with lots of AJI (green sauce) cravings. I can't wait to go back, and try the rest of the things on their menu. I'm a tough critic when it comes to peruvian food, especially since my boyfriend is peruvian. I learned from the best :)

We have been here twice and this is by far the worst place in Vegas. First time they completely forgot one of our meals but whatever we still went back because the food was decent and it was close. I called and made reservations and specifically said I need a high chair. When we got there they told us we need to wait thirty minutes despite our reservation because they took a big party. They were not even apologetic. So then I was like fine can I get a high chair they said on no we gave it to the big party... I told them I called ahead stating I need one and they said yea well we gave it to someone else. We just left they did nothing to even try to accommodate. Only go here if you want to be treated badly. Worst place in Las Vegas hands down including dives... You'll get better service at a 24 hour hole in he wall filled with smoke and the food is not that great... Over priced beans and rice.

This was a nice restaurant with a pretty good atmosphere.  I hadn't eaten Peruvian food for about 10 years, so I was long overdue!  This was more of an mid to upscale place compared to my usual Peruvian haunt (El Pollo Inca in LA).  I had to ask for the green spicy Aji sauce and it came in a bowl with a spoon (instead of a clear squirt bottle :P ).  We had the "Peruvian Seafood Paella" dish and the Arroz con Pollo.  The portions were quite large and everything tasted great and was very flavorful.  The only thing I regret was not getting something with rice and fries mixed in...  Miss that stuff!

Stormy and I checked out this place a few days ago. I have to say that I'm a bit shocked that I seem to be a closet Peruvian cuisine fan. I've been impressed with every Peruvian place I've visited in the past few years (from Panama to Kentucky and now Nevada). MPSAG did not disappoint. We were tired from a day of driving when we found this place (Thanks Yelp! for another good recommendation). Started off with Peruvian beer and this was good too. We tried the Chaufa Especial. On the menu they liken it to fried rice but for me it was much closer to a good Southern Jambalaya than Chinese. Hearty rice filled with meats and shrimp. No skimping here. One of the most filling an satisfying platter style dishes I've had in years. Sadly, my biggest regret about this place is that I won't get to explore the huge selection on the menu or the specials. What you get when you stumble on someplace during a roadtrip. I know its a little out of the way in Henderson but it's well worth hunting down. I'd only go if I was hungry as there is too much good food here.

When you walk in, you feel like you are walking into the humid rain forests of Peru, but that's because their air conditioning is not working or is off LOL!  Today, my friend and I came to Mi Peru for our lunch.    Ambiance- I haven't been to Peru but I think this restaurant embodies what I would expect to see in Peru. Lots of wood carvings, Latin prints and what seemed like an Alpaca fur rug. One of their walls is made of ply wood with its original "Home Depot" stamping...how vintage! LOL Their bathrooms are single stall bathrooms and seems clean enough.  They have a couple of TVs playing the game and the servers are dressed in black button downs and slacks with a long apron.   Food- I ordered the chicharrones for $11.95.  As stated on the menu, it's a traditional Peruvian dish, crispy and tender pork chunks. Served with salsa criolla and yams, which I've substituted with rice.  I could tell the rice was cooked in some kind of broth, because there was a lot of flavor.  The chunks of pork was super tender and was really marbleized.  I think that's a really good thing!  I also think they used cumin because there was a smokey taste to it.  Wasn't a lot of salt so I added some.  Later I discovered that the salsa, a combo of red onions and tomatoes, was to be eaten together and brought an insane combination with the pork.  My friend who had the yams instead of the rice seemed to really enjoy it as well.    All in all, the server was really pleasant and very efficient since we told him we were on our lunch break.  I had a great first impression of the place and will be returning to Mi Peru to try other dishes :)

I've seen this place for about 9 years before I ever decided to try it and wished I wouldn't have waited so long. But since my first visit I've been back several times.  The food: The first time I tried the Lomo Saltado (steak stir fried with tomatoes, onions and French fries) and wow, that was delicious. My mother used to make this same dish when I was young but I didn't realize that it was a Peruvian dish. I put 2 and 2 together and realized she had learned to make it from a Peruvian friend she had. That brought me back to my childhood in a big way. My girlfriend ordered the same dish and she just loves it and orders it every time. Since then I've ordered the Seco do Carne, which the meat is so tender and tasty, and I've also ordered the chicken and rice, muy eccellente.  The place: Its a small to average sized restaurant in a strip mall with Peruvian decor. It's always clean and decorated nicely. There's always people dining but never super busy that you have to wait. There is music playing and although not South American music it is still nice. I wish they had some outdoor seating for those days when the weather is perfect. There is a great area right outside that they could utilize if the landlord and finances would permit.   The service: I've only see one waiter there, Antonio. Probably because we tend to go at the same time every time. He is very friendly and on the spot with everything.

Living 600 miles away from my grandma's home cooking, this place sure fills a void in my life. As close to her cooking as I can find here. Pretty authentic and fills your tummy. The best Peruvian food I have ever eaten (aside from my grandma's of course) is right here!!

Meh. I'm kinda surprised that Mi Peru has such high ratings! It was my first time trying Peruvian food and I'm still a little undecided about it.  FOOD: - lomo saltado (but with fish!) - I don't eat beef so we asked to substitute it with fish and they did! This was very very good and HUGE portions! - chauffa de pollo - this basically tasted like chicken fried rice. Quite disappointed in this. We ended up combining both dishes to make our own! :)  SERVICE: Extremely friendly! Mi Peru was SO DEAD when we came here on a Friday night. There were two other couples eating but it was very very quiet. There seemed to only be one lady but she came to check in on us several times and was very friendly and nice.  I'd definitely give Peruvian food another try but not sure if it will be back at Mi Peru.

This place is incredible. We just moved to Henderson from N Phx & this was one of the 1st restaurants we tried as it is literally steps from our house. I was a little bummed that the Pollo A La Brasa wasn't available when we were there (only Thurs-Sun) but after the meal we had, I knew we'd be back so I was excited to try it in the future.   I ordered the Arroz con Mariscos ($15.95) which was delicious & HUGE. It was filled with plenty of seafood that was perfectly cooked. I asked for a little bit of their Aji sauce to try out since I make it at home regularly & it is one of my favorite condiments. I put it on almost everything! It was very good & spicy although the mayo flavor was pretty strong.   My husband ordered the Tallarines Verdes ($14.95) which was equally huge & very tasty.   The wait for our food was a little on the slow side but that wasn't a concern for us. We had no where to go & it was nice to sit & talk while we waited for our food. The only reason I mention it, is that if you are an impatient person or in a rush to be somewhere else, this might not be the best choice for you. Save it for a time when you can go & enjoy a leisurely night out.   I was a little sad to see only one other table occupied while we there & I really hope this place sticks around. SO happy to have a great dining option so close to us.. we will definitely be back!

I was originally very nervous coming here due to the fact that my boyfriend loves to horrify me about peruvians eating guinea pig.   However... for my more conservative people out there ...do not be afraid.   I was completely blown away with how awesome everything was. Sure ...certain entrees cost a little more... around 20.  But the amount of food they give you is insane. Its like ordering two orders at a normal place. The rest of the menu is completely within range of normal food prices.  I had beef kabobs and my boyfriend had a giant seafood platter. Everything was cooked to perfection and the quality was amazing. Love that the food is spiced well, different, and tasty.  They have healthier options as well as fried stuff when youre in the mood to be a fatty.   The place itself is really welcoming. We showed up 10 minutes before closing and the staff were really nice and did not make us feel like an obligation. They gave us things to snack on while we waited for our take out and had some beers. I never once felt rushed. Even though we showed up 10 minutes before closing on a monday, the food was made to order and did not taste like we'd been given the leftover scraps of the day.   I Cant wait to try other things on the menu!!  Seriously. GO HERE

I have never experienced a business owner so determined to maintain the reputation of his business. After my negative yelp review I was very pleasantly surprised when my issue was resolved so professionally and i was treated like a valuable customer. I know every business makes mistakes but as long as they handle it like this restaurant owner did i would gladly remain a Customer as i am with mi peru. Thank you!

We are going back on Friday!!!!  So after trying Peruvian food for the first time in San Bernardino Ca at (El Rico Pollo) The food was amazedly delicious! I couldn't wait to get back home and look for a peruvian restaurant in my home town Las Vegas. So after reading a few reviews I found "Mi Peru" and all I kept thinking oh please let the ceviche de pescado taste the same from the other place I first went to and it did! All the flavors were the same except that the other place it was much spicier and I LOVE spicy food. Maybe I can request it much spicier when I am there Friday. The food and the service was excellent!! Btw our waiter had the most Beautiful eyes! :P
Excellent food and service. So far, the Loma Saltado is my favorite, but I'll be trying the Pescado Sudado next time. Nice, quiet atmosphere.

I've been coming here for several years. Since it opened. Today I had planned a going away lunch for a good friend of mine. When I got there at 1130 the restaurant was not open. I sat outside for a few minutes getting ready to call the number and a gentleman walked out and told me that the kitchen was not clean, they didn't have food ready and that they weren't going to be open for a while. I explained to him at the time is 11 o'clock on the door. He then told me that they were very busy yesterday and they are busy cleaning. Very unapologetic and bothered. What a disappointment and what a poor way to handle business. You lost a very good customer.

Having been living off dennys and fast food for 3 days I was dying for something to curb my foodie cravings. I found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try. I like Peruvian food and was hoping it was as good as the place I go to back home.   Well, I came here for lunch at around 2pm and the place was empty. never a good sign. We sat down and got menus and the prices were shocking. Plates ran anywhere from $11 to $16. No way am I going to pay that much for Peruvian food at lunch time. And they only have Pollo ala Brasa after 4pm?? thats that all about? needless to say I left without eating.

Missing a home cooked meal?Try this place out here located in Henderson. If you are craving authentic Peruvian food that is mom and pop atmosphere, you can check this place out.   Menu has a lot to choose from. Most of the prices on the menu can range from $9-23 depending if it is meat or seafood. If you have not tried Peruvian food before, I would suggest Lomo Saltado (beef, onions, tomatoes, and french fries w/side of white rice) for your entree or the rotesseri chicken (you can choose from 2 pcs ($9) or the 4 pcs ($14) depending on how hungry you are). The chicken comes w/a huge plate of fries. This will give your mouth a little taste of what Peruvian food has to offer.  What we ordered: fiance had the 4 pcs of rotesseri chicken w/fries. As for me, I ordered the Arroz Con Mariscos  (rice with seafood (scallops, mussels, shrimps, and octopus and veggies (peas and carrots)). We also received complimentary salad for the both of us to share.  The food was phenomenal. Rotesseri chicken came out juicy, evenly seasoned and not dry. I was in awe just with one bite. Use the special green sauce that adds a little spice to add the wow factor. Fries of plate, I hope you love them! They give you a whole plate . The arroz con Mariscos, was bomb. It had moistness, fresh, and the seafood still had the proper balance and taste. To drink try their traditional corn drink or passion fruit. This will add sweetness to your meal. Want to go all out, the also serve wine direct from Peru or beer.   All in all, we came out with happy tummys and satisfied. Will definitely come back to taste other platters on the menu.

Supper yummy food!  My friends and I tried an assortment of dishes. We had the papa a huancaina. It was okay, a bit cold. My friend has the pollo saltado and it was so full of yummy veggies and fries! Another friend got the fried chicken and was soooooo gooood. I had the anticucho de lomo and it was so tender and the potatoes were super crispy. We also had desert. It was like a cheesecake custard thing. So glad to have tried a new type of cuisine. Cozy ambience, and stellar service.

I cannot say I have ever eaten Peruvian food or maybe I just can't distinguish it from other Spanish influenced foods. I am not a fan of foods covered in thick sauces unless it is a curry, so I stuck to arroz con pollo, which leads me back to my first statement. I eat this dish when I go to Cuban restaurants, so I might not have gotten a true taste of Peru. Of course, I got a side of fried plantains, but for $4.50 I have received a more satisfying amount at other establishments. I can eat these sweet treats by the truckload, so I was rather disappointed.   The arroz con pollo was delicious. My favorite item on the plate were the onions, in a citrus dressing, instead of the chicken or rice. I ended up eating all of it to refresh my palate after every bite of the rice. The chicken was moist, but a little on the bland side. The rice was really flavorful, but a little greasy. I would have also liked it if it came with a side of black beans, but it didn't. I guess I have always come to expect a plate to come with rice, beans, plantains, chicken and onions.   The serving size was large. I packed half of it to take home. I would go back, but I will do my research so that I can claim to have an authentic experience next time.

Great food, good beer. It was really nice to have South American food while staying here in Henderson, it tasted almost just like when I was in Peru. Only complaint here would be the check that took a little long to get to the table.

Yums! Planned to eat here upon arrival in Henderson, NV the night before the 25th Las Vegas Bowl. Let's go Aztecs! As expected, the food is fantastic. Ordered the Ceviche de Pescado (pictured) I have to stop writing this review and eat the ceviche before my husband gobbles it all up. Also devoured the Yuquitas Fritas before moving on to entrees, Tallarines Verdes con carne (pictured) and  Arroz con mariscos. Residents in this area should become regulars, if not already. Passing through, definately worth stopping by for the best Latin Cuisine.

Peruvian cuisine is something I have limited knowledge and experience, but I'm definitely open to eating more especially since what I have eaten at Mi Peru has been delicious. I've been here multiple times for dinner, but I've most recently come for lunch and the specials.  It's a small restaurant in the strip mall on the northwest corner of Stephanie and Horizon Ridge. Most likely the owner, Raymi, will be present to greet you and provide service for your meal. Always friendly, and eager to provide suggestions, he'll help you find something to your liking. The menu is filled with traditional Peruvian takes on proteins of chicken, beef, and seafood also using ingredients like yucca, plantains, yams, and the aji chili to compliment those proteins.  Lunch specials are $8.95 and come with a cup of soup. You'll get some corn nuts with an aji sauce to snack on when you first sit down. Be careful, there's no subtlety with that aji chili, it'll hit you right away. I've had the arroz con pollo and the aji de gallina on my most recent visits for lunch. The former dish had a nicely cooked, flavorful chicken thigh, but a  ton of rice (get this dish if you're looking to carbo load). The aji de gallina consisted of chicken breast with a spicy cream sauce and steamed rice, definitely my favorite of the two. Other dishes I've had in the past that I've been pleased with were the ceviche de pescado and the lomo saltado.  Prices are slightly elevated and service has been consistent. With Latin and Asian influences, Mi Peru can be a nice change of pace from your regular dining rotation and may be worth a visit to discover something new.

We have been there couple of times.  The foods are delicious but just long wait.  The Peruvian wine is bliss!! Love it.  I haven't tried their lunch special yet. But we shall go there one day.  Very nice set up inside and clean.  They need more business.. Anyone coming out to Henderson come try mi Peru in a nice and quiet plaza.

Came here during a weekday around 1pm. It's located in a quiet strip mall in Henderson. It's really all about the location. If they were located off a busier street, like south eastern, they'd be booming! S eastern has soooooo many mediocre restaurants that are always packed (Ahem egg works, pho mailan); this place is actually really good but there was no one else in the restaurant at the time, which was sad.   I got the chicken and rice lunch special (don't judge). It was delicious, though the chicken serving was slightly small. When asked about it the server got defensive rather than asking how he could make it better. Other than that, the server was very nice and helpful. He read out and translated all the specials (it was like 8-10 things).   The chicken was just a small leg and thigh, but it was juicy, delicious, and I am so glad it was dark meat (I am a dark meat gal, no innuendo intended! ;)). There was a ton of fried rice though, maybe two+ cups (that's a ton of rice, a typical serving is one cup). The Peruvian fried rice had peas and carrots in it and tasted like the rice was cooked in chicken stock. both the chicken and rice was really flavorful.   My mom got the chicken soup which she liked but the broth was made from store bought chicken stock (so not homemade chicken stock).   What I didn't like was that I saw that the lunch specials came with soup, but we weren't offered any soup. I didn't have the energy to put up a fuss, so we didn't ask about it.   Our meal came with a small serving of fried corn kernels with aji sauce (basically a spicy cilantro sauce, theirs was awesome).  4 stars because it seemed like they were trying to save $ due to the low customer turnout. Hence the small chicken pieces and the defensive response, the store bought chicken stock, and the lack of soups with our lunch specials. But the food is delicious, service is good, and I'd hate to see this place go under!
Mi peru my dish is the Lomo Saltado....Peruvian food it was very very good....didn't know what this was going to be like but it was very flavorful..

This review is long overdue, but better late than never.  Despite arriving last minute without reservations and with about a hour left before closing (restaurant was empty and was getting a mop-down), our server was super friendly and didn't make us feel rushed at all. He took the time to ask us questions as to what Peruvian dishes I've had in the past and made recommendations of his favorite dishes. Our food arrived pretty quickly, giving us ample time to drink, eat and talk story without feeling rushed.   LOMO SALTADO ($15.95):  http://bit.ly/2z4NEzY Generous cuts of tender sirloin, onions and tomatoes stir-fried with soy sauce, red wine vinegar and cumin. Not only was it served over crispy fries, steamed white rice was also included. This is my usual go-to dish and Mi Peru didn't disappoint.  TALLERINES VERDES CON CARNE ($15.95):  http://bit.ly/2zkYBOB The steak is marinated in the same soy-based sauce used for the Lomo Saltado dish. Juicy and cooked to a perfect med rare. The pasta is not your usual pesto. Aside from the usual basil and parmesan, I also tasted spinach and red onions (or shallots). The luscious pesto sauce (tasted like milk or cream was used) coated the al dente pasta evenly, not overdressed, just the perfect amount.  PERUVIAN FRIED CHICKEN (2 pc for $10.95, 4 pc for $14.95): Ordered the 2-pc and got a huge leg quarter along with crispy french fries.  http://bit.ly/2hpOcGO The marinade could've used more salt or soy sauce but you could definitely taste the cumin and paprika. There were some crispy edges but overall it seemed more like a roasted chicken dish rather than fried, still tasty though. Absent was the zesty cilantro sauce that usually accompanies this chicken dish.   ARROZ CON MARISCOS ($17.95):  http://bit.ly/2xDteui The menu listed it as a "Peruvian Paella" with octopus, calamari and oysters but I guess they were all out of some ingredients because ours just came with shrimp, calamari and 2 mussels. It was basically fried rice with seafood, just fluffy rice, absent of that creamy paella finished with a flavorful socorrat crust on the bottom. Not bad, but nothing spectacular either.  CHICHARRON DE CALAMARES ($14.95):  http://bit.ly/2z5Itjk You all know I can't resist ordering fried calamari if it's on the menu! These were well seasoned and the thin coating of batter gave it a fantastic crunch. Lots of crispy tentacles (my fav part) to go around.  Served with fries and a fresh onion salad.   So glad my Henderson friends introduced me to one of their favorite eats while I was in town, great friendly service and the food is delicious!

Place was empty, we were the only ones there. Everything on the menu is pricey so I ordered plátanos and they were good. My husband got Arroz con mariscos and it was very spicy. Service was good but we will not be coming back.

We really wanted to give this place a chance to become our neighborhood restaurant. So we decided to give it a try and went there today: According to Yelp it closes at 9pm (which is quite early for my taste), so we rushed and arrived there at 8.15. But the attendant didn't seem to be happy to welcome new guests and immediately told us in a flabbergasted way that they close actually at 8.30. We didn't feel like eating there anymore and decided to go to Tokyo Boys instead.

I ate here ages ago and forgot to review this.  We came here equipped with a restaurant.com certificate ready to try some Peruvian food for the first time ever.  I didn't realize until we got here that the certificate needed us to spent $50, and if you ever go here you will realize that is difficult for two people without ordering a huge banquet of food.  The prices are very very low with huge portions.  I had heard that the weekend house specialty, Pollo a la Brasa, was really good and wanted to try it.  It is supposed to be available after 2pm Thursday through Sunday, and we went on a Friday at 5pm.  They said it was not available and they were still cooking it, and I was really sad because I have been looking forward to trying it for awhile.    Instead, since we had to spend 50 bucks, I looked for the most expensive entree, Jalea Mi Perú, which is an insane amount of deep fried seafood with onions.  It was one of the biggest plates of fried food I have ever seen in my life and I could barely dent it.  My husband ordered Tacu Tacu con Lomo Saltado, which is beef tenderloin sauteed with tomato and onion.  It had some beans and rice "cake" like mixture that I thought was very tasty, but my husband is not adventurous and did not touch it.  Otherwise he enjoyed his dish.  Also we split a hearty chicken soup and some plantains as an appetizer.  The chicken soup was one of the best soups we've had.  When I feel sick I might come here just to pick up this soup if matzo ball soup isn't available.  The check came out to 20ish with the certificate.  It was very reasonable, but next time I would get a lower denomination certificate, maybe $10.  It was just way too much food.

Delicious meal with great service. More people need to come and try this place.   We ordered the ceviche and the lomos saltado. Both were made beautifully.   The ceviche was fresh with perfect amount of acid.   The lomos (steak with tomatoes, onions, and French fries) was tender and paired well with the vegetables. Ask for their green sauce on the side, it's delicious on everything. They were nice enough to give me some to take home too!   The prices might look a little steep if you're going for a casual meal but the size and execution makes it worth it for me. We left happy and full.

This was much less than I expected as far as atmosphere, but exceed on flavor. It is a small mom and pop, with posters on the wall and hard wooden chairs. That said, the food was delicious!. Lacking in presentation, but full on flavor. I had the kabobs. Gave the beef heart to my friend and I had the chicken and beef tenderloin. Sooo tender, and full of a slow cooked flavor I can't fully describe. Out of this world. The side dishes need improvement, I got 1.5 boiled potatoes, and some hard white beans. But I will go back for that meat again. My friends all enjoyed their dinners as well.

Holy Smokes!   Was completely caught off guard by this unassuming little place!   Cozy business that shows off in a good way that this is a family run place.  Very clean and homey.  We felt very welcome and comfortable.    After taking drink orders we got to the business of deciding on dishes.   The wife chose Pescado Sudado which was a delicious poached white fish in a wine sauce.  It was a beautiful dish and very tasty.   I ordered the Peruvian fried chicken at the suggestion of our server.  I was originally grub to order the Cau Cau Pollo but he changed my mind.  And OH BOY I am glad that he did!   It was amazing and just fantastic.   It came with a pile of fries and a side salad.     The quantity, quality and pricing were all spot on.  The service was a bit slow but they had several tables and you should expect this from a family run establishment.   Our server was very friendly and asked if we had been to the restaurant before.  It was a very genuine question and he explained a few items to us.    Overall the entire meal was just great.   If you want Latin food with a twist from the norm, give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed.

Great Peruvian surprise! Highly recommend, we had just finished the 2016 world's toughest mudder when we decided to go back and eat there again two days in a Role! Everything is Spectacular the waiter was awesome too, you won't be disappointed. We are from San Diego and eat out everywhere this was great. Thanks!

I want to try something new since I never have Latin foods before. I ordered the pollo Saltado to go. Fries on side. No soy sauce. Fine with me as long as no salt on it. all good. About $17 for the meal. Food came out of two big food containers. Not worth it. Small portion. Not enough for the price being paid. Chicken strips is dried. I wanted something with fries so I got this plate. I didn't even get my rice that was suppose to come with the meal! I'm just disappointed. First time and the last time for me.

This was the first place I ate in Vegas when I arrived this summer and it just happened to be across the street from where I'm staying--Awesome. I've had Peruvian before, at a couple places in LA including Mario's. But this place was way more memorable:   Food: I ordered the 1/2 chicken while my roommates go varieties of pollo saltado and fried rice. The portions were huge! At least 1.5 servings of food per person, the only reason we were able to finish was because everything tasted so good. My chicken was cooked perfectly with the right amount of crisp and it was still juice, it even came with fries! My entire group thoroughly enjoyed their food. But the main kicker was the...  SAUCE! I can't take too much heat even though I'm Korean, but the two sauces they passed out were super addicting despite how spicy they were. If the waitress serves just one sauce, ASK FOR THE OTHER ONE! One of my roommates actually asked her if they sold bottles, it's that good.   Environment was your typical mom & pop shop, I'm assuming it's family owned. Food was awesome with great flavor, waitress was really patient with us and helped us navigate the menu, and I'll definitely be back for that sauce.   Highly recommend!

If you have been to Peru and love the food - you WILL love this place too! The flavor of the meats are delicious. You will not be disappointed. For a real peruvian meal experience order either Inka Cola or Chicha Morada as your beverage. For appetizer, order the papa a la huancaina. If you like raw fish, get the ceviche de pescado too! They have a website with picture and the menu in case you want to explore more. If you are a meat and potatoes fan - you will love peruvian food. I enjoyed the pollo saltado and anticucho de pollo or lomo. You will want to go again and again!

This place has solid Peruvian food! The menu explains exactly what is in each dish, and the staff is very helpful if you have any questions.  Most dishes come with fries and a sauce. I cannot, for the life of me, remember what the green sauce is called but it is delicious! I had a breaded chicken breast, seasoned with rosemary, thyme, and a plethora of other herbs, and it was delicious. The fries were crispy, not soggy, and they have a wide selection of drinks from South America.   If you are in the mood for something different, try this hidden gem in Henderson!

mi peru is one of the best peruvian restaurants i have ever been to. you can taste the authentic quality taste in their dishes. my friend and i enjoyed both of the dishes we got. mi peru offers a lunch special on MONDAY- THURSDAY from 11am- 3pm. 5-6 dishes are priced at $8.95. we got the papa a la huancaina and the arroz con pollo. the potatoes and egg is always delightful with the yellow sauce.   my favorite was the arroz con pollo dish with the rice and chicken. the dish came with a side of pickled onions that made the whole meal. the chicken was so moist and flavorful and the rice was really good. im only in vegas for a little time but i wouldn't mind to come back to try the other dishes. the server also gave us some fried corn kernels with the green sauce which was great!  the ambiance is quiet with low music and the furniture is very traditional. service was great and always made sure everything was going good. i would definitely recommend coming here for a nice lunch or dinner.
Lomo saltado was excellent veggies simmered just right dish was delicious was worth the wait will be back

Over the past 6 months my wife and I have tried just about every dish on the menu and we've liked them all! It's great having a restaurant like this in Henderson. We usually start with papas a la huancaina and go from there!

This place is like a secret gem. The chicken dish Mi Peru Aji de Gallina is my favorite! It was so good! Truly some great comfort food. Also, the fish Cevice was amazing! I will always come here when I'm looking to get a hearty meal. The restaurant never has too many people inside, which means I always get great service. Plus Peruvian beer is pretty good too.
Bomb Food! Im crazy about the aguadito de pollo soup and the pescado ceviche. I eat here atleast once a week. Soooooooo GOOOD!

I was super impressed by this place!  We strolled in on a Saturday evening and ordered the yuquitas fritas, arroz con mariscos, and a 1/2 order of the pollo a la brasa. The chicken was my main attraction that night (it's only available Thursday - Sunday, after 3pm).  It was pretty late, I think about an hour from closing and so there were only a few tables left and one waiter manning the floor. He was really nice, but busy. He still managed to greet us, offer us menus and a seat at a booth. He takes our order and offers us water while we wait. Super nice! He quotes us 15 minutes, comes out at around 20 to apologize and assure us it'll only be a few more minutes. It's totally ok as we did order quite a few different dishes, but the head's up is totally appreciated!  Our orders come as promised, and he takes the time to tell us what each box contained and which sauces are for what. I ask for aji sauce and he gladly gives me a couple of cups. This guy is outstanding. I wish I remembered his name, but my ass is horrible with names...I just hope every staff member here is as good as him.   The food was delicious! The yuquitas were still kind of crispy and it came with a mild, creamy Peruvian sauce. But the real star was the pollo and the aji sauce. The chicken was delicious, fall off the bone tender, and flavorful. Mmmm, paired with the spicy, thick aji sauce and *drooool* Next time I'm definitely going to order a whole chicken! We were stuffed though (the yuquitas are no joke) and saved the arroz con mariscos for lunch the next day. I really wish I ate it when it was freshly made, so I can't really comment on it. It was still good, but I know it would've been better fresh.   I'm definitely coming back!

Had to update my review as the owners took action on a few things.   They got a new chef!!!  This chef is getting the Aji sauce right.  The exact amount of seasoning and the overall food is much MUCH better.  Most Def 5 Star quality now.  Must haves: Llomo Saltado, Aji Sauce, Plantains, Seafood Mixto (Ceviche).  Enjoy!!

I was absolutely craving something different then your usual hamburger and pasta kind of day. Literally I could eat pasta everyday if prohibited.  As I searched Yelp for dinner ideas, I stumbled upon Peruvian.  I haven't had Peruvian in forever.  I miss those delicious cancha's (Peruvian corn nuts) those are seriously the most addicting things ever.  I must of ordered three extra servings. The server was nice enough to feed my addiction, my only complaint was there was none of the spicy green sauce or bread to accompany my hunger while we waited for our dishes. I was a little bummed that they didn't have the rotisserie chicken, I love eating.  I settled for the second best thing steak lomada (sorry if I misspelled that, I asked for the fries on the side for my picky eater.  My kiddo would probably have a melt down if his fries were smothered in that delicious sauce. I definitely was impressed with the dish, the meat was tender and soft, and the sauce had the perfect savory flavor I was craving.  I am not sure what my hubby ordered but it was delicious, the meat was tender and soft and bursting with flavor (no steak sauce needed) the egg was definitely a perfect touch. Overall this restaurant food was delicious and it wasn't too busy when we came. The service was a little slow, maybe because the food is prepared fresh and cooked on the spot.  So I will give them that, the server was nice and very helpful on any questions or suggestions.  Will I come back? Definitely! Would I recommend this place- yes!

The food has been great every time! The ambiance is okay, and the large windows with hard flooring makes temperature control a little card ( hot in summer, and cold in winter)  but the food and service make up for it. I would recommend trying anything on the menu, so far I haven't found anything I didn't like.

Stopped by here for lunch. We were the first customers of the day. The waiter was very polite and attentive. The food was excellent. I highly recommend this place. I hope they can weather the economic storm, as it was very quite in the center the whole time we were eating. Only one other couple came in as we were leaving.  We had the lunch specials, which included a drink or the soup of the day.

We went here on a recommendation and was very happy! ! I got the arroz con mariscos and my bf got a breaded beef with pesto pasta. Both were delicious. The service was very friendly too w/o being overly friendly!!

I took advantage of a leisure trip to Vegas and decided to try out this place on a nice sunday afternoon before going back to California. My party was of 4 people so our mad peruvian food feast started in a matter of minutes once we sat down lol  The dining room is decked out with nice Peruvian art work and paintings while the menu offers lots of fish, seafood, beef, chicken, pasta and vegetarian dishes, all made with Peruvian passion. Although they have some marvelous authentic appetizers, I decided to concentrate on the unique and adventurous entrees.  Our first two dishes were the Lomo Saltado, strips of lean top sirloin steak sautéed with tangy soy vinegar sauce with red onions, tomatoes, cilantro and French fries, and served with steamed white rice. This dish is all about flavors and textures and was very good and exquisite. The next dish is a meat lover's dream dish, the Parrillada Combo for up to 4 people. This platter consisted of wold-class and delicious Pollo a la brasa (rotisserie chicken), steak, 3 skewers of Anticuchos (beef hearts) along with fries and a salad. This parrillada combo was really exquisite and full of flavor, everything perfectly cooked and seasoned. To drink, we asked Cuzqueña beers which is the national beer for peruvians and it was just great! We ended our peruvian food feast with some Lucuma ice cream, really delicious! a must-have for ice cream lovers! :D The staff is friendly and the service is fast. Loved the fact that they had LCD screens showing some international soccer games.. This place rocks and I can't wait to come back and try more dishes.. 5 solid stars *****

I really want this place to make it. It's an interesting restaurant in MY neighborhood. The first time I went in for takeout I realized how cute it was inside (it was hard to tell from outside since it is in a strip mall). It's very warm and charming inside. Everything we had was great. It was the rotisserie chicken and the beef saltado. In fact, I liked the saltado so much that I looked up how to make it on the Internet and have been making the chicken version about once a month. I went in for girls night out again last week. The girls, who had never been there before, loved it. We got the steak kabobs and they were a favorite. They have a pretty decent, although small, wine list. I recommend the Torrontes. Very inexpensive but delicious and refreshing with spicy savory dishes. The only problem I had was with the glassware. One of the girls' water glass was gross, and all of our wine glasses smelled like a sour dish rag. Gag! Other than that, I think this restaurant is a great addition to my little neighborhood, and I hope they stay busy and make it through this crappy economy. They should have a happy hour too BTW.

Love this place. Been here twice. I had arroz con pollo both times and OMG, soooo good. Full of flavors, chicken falls of the bone. Gotta ask for the green sauce, they don't automatically give it to you. I had the flan too. Very good as well.
